intro: Brachystelma prostratum, commonly known as the prostrate stonecrop, is a succulent plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Aizoaceae, which is characterized by its fleshy leaves and showy flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid environments. Its leaves are thick and fleshy, storing water to help it survive in dry conditions. It produces small, star-shaped flowers in shades of yellow and orange, typically blooming in spring.
